pullRequest.title: Break up big crafting jobs
pullRequest.bodyText:
Changes proposed in this pull request:

Break crafting jobs into chunks based on the ingredients fitting in the inventory of the crafter

This resolves the problem with cases where a crafting job requires more slots to load the recipe than the citizen has available.  this becomes very visible when the recipe uses an ingredient with a maxStackSize of 1, and the output stacks higher than the number of inventory slots on the citizen.
Today, we have a special recipe for level 3 bakery that uses water bottles, and making a stack of that recipe needs 32 of those, with a total slot requirement of 33 + 1 for output.
The solution is to recognize the max recipe iterations we can load inputs for, and instead of creating a single crafting job of the full amount, calculate the maximum size we can process, and break it up into batches of that or smaller to accomplish the task.
Review please

commit.message: Break up crafting jobs to ensure it fits inventory
Make inventory usage scale with size
Add a few comments to explain what is going on
